intro: Tetranthera furfuracea, commonly known as the hairy tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Tetranthera furfuracea is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
